lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use JSX to display the title of the movie.

Make sure to pick return followed by <h1> and then The Matrix, </h1>.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Display the passed property online.

Make sure to pick props followed by String and then (, props, .online, ).

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Pass the wizard's name and display it.

Make sure to pick name followed by = and then "Gandalf", {, props, ., name, }.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
How can you display a boolean value in React?

Convert it to a string using String()Use it directly as textAdd it inside curly braces without conversionBoolean values display automatically

Convert it to a string using String().

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Convert a boolean into a string before rendering.

Make sure to type String.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
Analyze the function below. What will it log when the button is clicked?

GoodbyeHelloNo output will appearIt will cause an error

Make sure to pick Goodbye.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which of these is a valid way to define state in React using useState for a counter?

const [count, setCount] = useState(0)const (count, setCount) = useState([0])const count = useState(0)setCount(useState() = 0)

const [count, setCount] = useState(0).

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
In a React component, which import statement is appropriate for using the useState hook?

import React, { useState } from "react"import useState from "react"import { React, useState } from "react"import React from "useState"

import React, { useState } from "react".

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the purpose of using useState in a React component?

To declare state variables whose changes React will re-renderTo directly update the DOM elementsTo handle side-effects like API callsTo manage CSS styles within components

To declare state variables whose changes React will re-render.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Display the JSX element stored in the hero variable.

Make sure to type {hero}.

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which of these JSX elements correctly references a variable inside the expression?

<p>{message}</p><p>message</p><p>[message]</p><p>$message</p>

Make sure to pick <p>{message}</p>.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a variable holding JSX and reference the variable in the JSX that the component returns.

Make sure to pick greeting followed by { and then greeting, }.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What will happen if you try to render this boolean property directly in React?

The boolean value won't showTrue will display as textFalse will display as textError message will appear

The boolean value won't show.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Will this render as expected?

YesNo, the props are not passed in index.jsxNo, the props are mixed up in index.jsxNo, the component is not exported correctly

Make sure to pick Yes.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code to enable the use of the state variable likes.

Make sure to pick const followed by [ and then likes, ,, setLikes, ], useState, (0).

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Write a React component that displays "Let's get started!" in the console when a button is clicked.

Make sure to pick startReactApp followed by onClick and then =, {, startReactApp, }.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set the initial value of the state variable counter to 10.

Make sure to type useState(10).

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code to enable the use of the useState hook.

Make sure to pick import followed by { and then useState, }, from, "react", ;.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Display the passed property author.

Make sure to type {props.author}.

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
In the following component, what is displayed when the online prop is set to false?

Online? falseOnlineOnline? trueThe code will not execute

Online? false.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Pass "Gamer" for the username, 9999 for the score, and true for the isVIP properties.

Make sure to pick "Gamer" followed by { and then 9999, }, {, true, }.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
If you want to access both type and brand within the Vehicle component, which object will you use?

propsstatethisdocument

Make sure to pick props.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a React button that, upon clicking, calls the expressFun function in the console without wrapping it in an arrow function.

Make sure to type onClick={expressFun}.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What value will be displayed after the button is clicked twice?

68104

Make sure to pick 6.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
Given the following code snippet, what would be the initial value of status?

"offline""online"No initial valueundefined

Make sure to pick "offline".

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the toggle function to switch the boolean value of the isOpen state variable.

Make sure to pick const followed by toggle and then = () => {, };.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Call the setter function to update the theme accordingly.

Make sure to type setTheme.
